result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alberto Medellin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alberto Medellin in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM

Pursuant to negotiations, case is DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing in case#15CF2639.

Attorney Ann Heaps in court for attorney Michael Jude, defendant Alberto Medellin not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Defendant in custody not produced, appearance waived.  Case calendared for further proceedings.  Defense informs Court that this case is to be included in a global resolution.  Court ordered case transferred to Branch 15, Judge Watts.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Gabriela Leija appearing for attorney Michael Jude in court, Defendant Alberto Medellin not in court, in custody.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not produced for purposes of this hearing. Defendant has a pending felony case, Homicide (15CF002639). Further proceedings will be set before Branch 21.    All parties are notified that effective March 7, 2016, this case will be assigned to the Honorable Cynthia Davis, Branch 21, in Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Further proceedings scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Alberto Medellin not in court, in custody.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not produced, appearance waived.  Statements by defense counsel that defendant has a pending felony scheduled for jury trial 4-25-2016.  Defense requests a status conference date.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Alberto Medellin not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not produced, appearance waived.  Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Statements by defense counsel that defendant has a pending felony case and requests that this case tag along. Court orders case adjourned for status conference to Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Alberto Medellin in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Alberto Medellin in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for projected plea and sentencing hearing. There is not a global resolution in this matter, State will be issusing new charges. Case to return to misdemeanor trial court. Defense request case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Per Branch 45 clerk, plea and sentencing hearing scheduled on 12-09-2015 at 8:30, branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, Defendant Alberto Medellin not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court will allow of the transfer of this case to Branch 17 for a global resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Alberto Medellin not in court, in custody.  Student Intern Morgan Wilz under the supervision of  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statements by defense counsel that defendant has a pending case set for projected guilty plea in Branch 17. Court will allow this case to be transferred to Branch 17 if Judge Stark is willing to accept jurisdiction.  Court orders case adjourned for status conference.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.
  Status conference scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Alberto Medellin not in court, in custody.  Morgan Wilz, appears as intern for the state under the student practice rule under the supervision of  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not produced, appearance waived.  Defendant has a pending felony case. Defense counsel requests a status conference date. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Alberto Medellin not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statements by defense counsel that defendant has a pending felony case scheduled for scheduling conference on 7-02-2015 in Branch 17.  Defense requests a status conference date. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with all Pick N Save stores in Milwaukee.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Alberto Medellin in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Alberto Medellin in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  The Court enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defense.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
